projects.title: Organisation Unit Manager
projects.subtitle: DHIS2 webapp
projects.description: This is a webapp that was made for the open source project DHIS2 in the open source course at UiO. The app use the DHIS2 web API to add and edit organistaion units. It also shows the location of a unit on a map.

projects.title: Streemer
projects.subtitle: Ionic app
projects.description: Cross-platform application that collects multiple streaming websites in one application. The application is made using the Ionic framework.

projects.title: CloudComics
projects.subtitle: Ionic app
projects.description: Cross-platform application that lets you read comic books(.cbr and .cbz format) from your cloud storage. This project is done with the Ionic framework.

projects.title: SimCV
projects.subtitle: Android app
projects.description: This is my bachelor thesis. It shows how the OpenCV library can be used together with the Android camera. Mostly Java, some C++.

projects.title: ShopList
projects.subtitle: Android app
projects.description: The first Android application I ever created was a shopping list, and it was not very good in terms of code and design. Now that I know Android better I decided to recreate the shopping list application.

projects.title: Firestorm
projects.subtitle: Android, Raspberry PI, Go, Python
projects.description: Remote control for a gas fireplace, built with Raspberry Pi and Android. Raspberry Pi runs a Python or a Go http server, which responds to GET requests from a Android application.

projects.title: pictureSort
projects.subtitle: Desktop app, C#
projects.description: Copies and sorts all the pictures in the Windows picture folder into a new folder. Pictures are sorted by date. Goal of this project is to learn C#. Still has some bugs and features missing.

projects.title: Photo  Viewer
projects.subtitle: Desktop client and server. Java
projects.description: A photo viewer client that connects to a server that serves the photos that the user has stored. Group project for the course software development at UiS. My responsibility was the database and the communication with it.
